title: Victoria's Secret worker caught drink driving blamed unsteady feet on beach sliders
text:

A glamorous saleswoman who caught drink driving said her beach sliders were making her unsteady on her feet.

Katie Leadbeater, 25, changed into her sliders, a style of beach shoe, from a pair of expensive heels she had been wearing on a night out in Manchester.

The Victoria's Secret worker was driving her Ford Mustang when it was spotted by CCTV operators who contacted police.

Officers then stopped her and noticed she was off balance when she exited the car, Manchester Magistrates Court heard.

Initially Leadbeater, from Turton, near Bolton blew nearly twice the alcohol limit during a roadside breath test.

A subsequent test showed she had 51 microgrammes of alcohol in 100 millilitres of breath.

The legal limit is 35mg.

(Image: Katie Leadbeater/ Cavendish Pres)

When quizzed by police, she told officers the sliders she was wearing were to blame for being "slightly unsteady" on her feet.

Leadbeater pleaded guilty to drink driving and was banned from driving for 12 months.

Nicola Durham prosecuting said: ''The defendant came to the police's attention after a CCTV operator highlighting concerns and notified them.

''They then located the vehicle and spoke to the defendant and came to the opinion that she had indeed consumed alcohol.

"A road side breathalyser reading in relation to that was 68mg but clearly that’s not the eventually reading and she was found to be 51mg at the police station.

(Image: Cavendish Press (Manchester) Ltd)

''The defendant was off balance when she got out the car but there was nothing in relation to her actual driving.

"She has no previous convictions.''

In mitigation for Leadbeater defence lawyer Ashley Barnes told the judge: ''The reading of 51mg is in the lower end of the spectrum but it still comes as an enormous surprise to her - although she accepts the reading.

''You will have read she was slightly unsteady on her feet.

"She was driving in sliders which you wear on the beach normally.

"She had been out somewhere nice wearing nice shoes and took them off not as she did not want to drive in those nice shoes.

"So far as any loss of balance that would be the main reason."

(Image: Katie Leadbeater/ Cavendish Pres)

Mr Barnes added: ''Her income monthly will go because she lives north of Bolton and she has a job in the Trafford Centre. It won’t be economically viable for her to get there and keep the job.'

Sentencing Deputy District Judge Alexandra Simmonds told Leadbeater: ''You pleaded guilty to driving having consumed too much alcohol on the day in question.

"Police where made aware of your presence by an operator of CCTV who said something they had seen made them concerned.

''Police arrived and you got out and were entirely cooperative but you had had too much to drink and were over the limit.

"Nobody has provided any evidence to show your driving was impaired and you have no previous convictions for driving or anything else.''

Leadbeater was also fined £360 and was ordered to pay £436 in costs and surcharges.
description: Katie Leadbeater, 25, changed into her sliders, a style of beach shoe, from a pair of expensive heels to drive home after a night out in Manchester
